@NCSAatIllinois
 · Aug 26, 2020
We are excited to announce the #AIFARMS Institute, a new $20m institute at @Illinois_Alma (@uofigrainger / @ACESIllinois / @IGBIllinois / NCSA) funded by the @NSF and @USDA_NIFA, which will seek to apply #AI to agriculture!

The Devil's Guide to Incremental Research

In the past years, I have noticed a number of "recipes" for scientific papers – patterns that maximize the number of publications despite limited significance. To raise awareness for these recipes, we have to name them. Enjoy! (1/18)

In 2017, Republicans passed a tax bill that provides 83% of the benefits to the top 1% & tried taking healthcare away from 32 million people. On Saturday, Democrats voted to provide 86% of Americans with direct payments & cash benefits to 93% of kids. Elections have consequences.

Under GOP control, Congress passed $1.9 trillion in tax cuts mainly for billionaires & corporations. 
Now, after one of the highest voter turnouts in history, we passed $1.9 trillion to help working families who are struggling.
Do not let anyone tell you your vote doesn't matter.

Hard to believe that it has been 20 years since our first discussions about a persistent, language-indep, machine-indep, SSA-based IR suitable for both static and JIT compilation. Design ideas rooted in compiler research like SSA, separation of concerns, LTO... #CelebrateLLVMllvm.org
@llvmorg
 · Dec 14, 2020
LLVM started 20 years ago today! From humble beginnings at UIUC, it has grown to include contributions from hundreds of people and powers countless products and impactful languages.  How have you used LLVM, contributed to it, or been touched by a product using it? #CelebrateLLVM

What the hell is happening in Portland, and why isn't every American who believes in the constitution, states rights, federalism, freedom, individual liberty and rule of law not screaming for answers loudly? Yes, Republican leaders, I mean you especially.

In Portland, federal agents in combat gear pulled protesters off the street and jailed them without charge. That is what a police state is all about. Now is the time to defend our Constitution. Now is the time to come together and defeat Trump's authoritarian policies.The Washington Post
@washingtonpost
 · Jul 17, 2020

Angry about Portland? Remember none of the DHS leaders were Senate confirmed. We have an acting Sec, acting Dep Sec, acting head of CBP, acting head of ICE. It’s been that way for over a *year*.

Tonight we will file a lawsuit in federal court against U.S. Department of Homeland Security, U.S. Marshals Service, U.S. Customs and Border Protection, and the Federal Protection Service alleging they seized and detained Oregonians without probable cause. 

Statement here:

We are becoming a police state ... for political purposes!Federal Agents Unleash Militarized Crackdown on Portland

Friends in academia!  This Wednesday, June 10, shut down all academic and STEM activities!  Use the time to discuss action plans for a more diverse and inclusive future: #ShutDownSTEM, #ShutDownAcademia.

ACM SIGPLAN’s statement of inclusivity — and a shout-out to CARES 
http://SIGPLAN.org/Inclusivity/

We CARES committee members are eager to work to educate ourselves and help others make at least the little PL research corner of the world a better place. 

If you are a scholar who'd like to talk, please get in touch: we're here for you. https://sigplan.org/Cares/ [3/3]

Computing, including little our PL corner,  suffers from radical & deeply problematic disparities of representation. CARES unequivocally supports the right of individuals to speak up about their suffering and for their rights. We condemn systemic racism and discrimination. [2/3]

This year, 
@SIGPLAN
 created CARES, an organization to listen to and help people who experience discrimination in our field. Recent events highlight why such organizations matter more than ever. [1 of 3]
